description:
Hi,

See http://forums.openstack.org/viewtopic.php?f=15&t=1150

I am using Openstack Essex (Ubuntu 12.04 lts).

Issue-1:
======
keypair contain invalid string
root@kallada:~# euca-describe-instances
RESERVATION r-0nqrhgmr a72cf29a471b47d591935c815d851e02 op_g1
INSTANCE i-00000028 ami-00000004 server-40 server-40 running op_k1 (a72cf29a471b47d591935c815d851e02, kallada) 0 m1.tiny 2012-04-30T08:09:48.000Z nova monitoring-disabled 192.168.22.42 192.168.22.42 instance-store

Showing op_k1 (a72cf29a471b47d591935c815d851e02, kallada) as keypair, but its original name is op_k1

Issue-2:
======
Attached Security groups do not showing in instance details.
I can see attached Security group when doing # euca-describe-instances
root@kallada:~# euca-describe-instances
RESERVATION r-0nqrhgmr a72cf29a471b47d591935c815d851e02 op_g1
INSTANCE i-00000028 ami-00000004 server-40 server-40 running op_k1 (a72cf29a471b47d591935c815d851e02, kallada) 0 m1.tiny 2012-04-30T08:09:48.000Z nova monitoring-disabled 192.168.22.42 192.168.22.42 instance-store

But attached Security groups do not showing in "Hybridfox" .
See attached screenshots
I also tried with boto API, but instance.groups returning an empty list.
See http://groups.google.com/group/boto-use ... 5087d98288
title: Openstack essex: issue in Keypair and Security group

comments.content:
Hi,

See http://forums.openstack.org/viewtopic.php?f=15&t=1150

I am using Openstack Essex (Ubuntu 12.04 lts).

Issue-1:
======
keypair contain invalid string
root@kallada:~# euca-describe-instances
RESERVATION r-0nqrhgmr a72cf29a471b47d591935c815d851e02 op_g1
INSTANCE i-00000028 ami-00000004 server-40 server-40 running op_k1 (a72cf29a471b47d591935c815d851e02, kallada) 0 m1.tiny 2012-04-30T08:09:48.000Z nova monitoring-disabled 192.168.22.42 192.168.22.42 instance-store

Showing op_k1 (a72cf29a471b47d591935c815d851e02, kallada) as keypair, but its original name is op_k1


Issue-2:
======
Security groups do not showing in
I can see attached Security group when doing # euca-describe-instances
root@kallada:~# euca-describe-instances
RESERVATION r-0nqrhgmr a72cf29a471b47d591935c815d851e02 op_g1
INSTANCE i-00000028 ami-00000004 server-40 server-40 running op_k1 (a72cf29a471b47d591935c815d851e02, kallada) 0 m1.tiny 2012-04-30T08:09:48.000Z nova monitoring-disabled 192.168.22.42 192.168.22.42 instance-store


But attached Security groups do not showing in "Hybridfox" .
See attached screenshots
I also tried with boto API, but instance.groups returning an empty list.
See http://groups.google.com/group/boto-use ... 5087d98288
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~sajuptpm

comments.content:
I'm not sure I understand what the bug is here.  In the first part you say the key name is "op_k1" but the original one is "op_k1".  Those are the same so I'm not sure what you're saying is the problem.

On the second part, we can't support HybridFox.  Please provide some more detail that shows the problem using the API, or simple command line tools (using boto, or using euca2ools is fine).
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~russellb

comments.content: We cannot solve the issue you reported without more information. Could you please provide the requested explanation ?
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~ttx

comments.content: This bug lacks the necessary information to effectively reproduce and fix it, therefore it has been closed. Feel free to reopen the bug by providing the requested information and set the bug status back to ''New''.
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~dims-v
